Package arcade.util

Class Colors

java.lang.Object
arcade.util.Colors
All Implemented Interfaces:
sim.util.gui.ColorMap
public class Colors
extends java.lang.Object
implements sim.util.gui.ColorMap
Implementation of ColorMap for discrete and continuous color selection.

Custom color map management for use with visualization classes in MASON library.

Since:
2.2
Version:
2.2.1

      Creates Colors table with modulo index.

      colors - the table of colors
      mod - the value of modulo on index before selecting color

    • Colors

      public Colors​(java.awt.Color minCol, java.awt.Color maxCol, double minVal, double maxVal)
      Creates Colors between two values.
      Parameters:
      minCol - the color associated with the lower bound
      maxCol - the color associated with the upper bound
      minVal - the value of the lower bound
      maxVal - the value of the upper bound

    • Colors

      public Colors​(java.awt.Color[] colors, double[] vals)
      Creates Colors between multiple values.
      Parameters:
      colors - the array of colors associated with each bound
      vals - the list of values at each bound

  • Method Details

    • interpColors

      private void interpColors​(java.awt.Color minCol, java.awt.Color maxCol, int start, int end)
      Interpolates between two colors.
      Parameters:
      minCol - the minimum color
      maxCol - the maximum color
      start - the starting value
      end - the ending value

    • getIndex

      private int getIndex​(double level)
      Gets color map index for given number value.

      Applies modulo if the mod is not zero. Index is determined as (length of bins in the colormap)*(level scaled between the minimum and maximum).

      Parameters:
      level - the number value
      Returns:
      the color map index
